title: A Comparative Review of the Histogram-based Image Segmentation Methods
author: Zhenzhou Wang (School of Computer Science and Technology, Huaibei Normal University), ..., Zhenzhou Wang
relevance_why: Histogram-based segmentation methods can be applied to audio analysis tasks, particularly in sound event detection, where understanding pixel intensity distribution can help delineate sound sources.
background: Image segmentation involves partitioning an image into meaningful regions, which is essential for tasks like object detection and recognition.
contribution: This paper introduces a taxonomy of histogram-based image segmentation techniques, addressing their principles, performance comparisons, and relevance to deep learning methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous histogram-based methods often struggled with complex backgrounds and lacked robustness; however, they yielded better performance than universal deep learning approaches without specialized training in simpler cases.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work categorizes the techniques into four main types and presents comparative evaluations against deep learning methods.

key_innovation: By categorizing histogram-based methods based on their principles (means-based, Gaussian mixture model, entropy-based, and feature-points-based), the paper systematically evaluates their strengths and weaknesses.
real_world_impact: This review offers insights for practitioners in fields like medical imaging and computer vision, encouraging the adoption of tailored histogram segmentation strategies, which could lead to better results in real-world applications.
limitations: The paper acknowledges that histogram-based methods generally struggle with non-uniform or complex backgrounds and thus proposes a complementary approach to deep learning.

new_terms.histogram-based segmentation: **Histogram-based segmentation** refers to techniques that use the distribution of pixel intensities (grayscale values) to divide an image into meaningful sections.
new_terms.Gaussian mixture model: **Gaussian mixture model** is a probabilistic model that assumes all data points are generated from a mixture of several Gaussian distributions with unknown parameters.
